The winning design of the twenty-sixth Venice Architecture Biennale, The Guest House, is now available for purchase by the artist in the form of a digital painting. The work, which depicts a group of homeless people sleeping in a forest, was inspired by a project by the artist to create a new home for homeless people in the city of Venice. The program was led by the designer of The Artist’s House, Stefano Dalla Monte, and was a response to the unprecedented flood of new housing construction in the city. The theme of the biennial is “Empowerment.” The program is available for digital purchase.The painting is a narrative of a group of homeless people living in a forest near Venice, who are awoken by the sound of construction. They decide to leave their sleeping quarters to help others to enter the construction site, and in the process become part of the work of an architect. The New Museum in New York has announced that it will postpone the next edition of the Art Basel Hong Kong, scheduled for October 2021, until March 2022 at the earliest. The exhibition will now be staged in the museum’s newly refurbished building on East Twenty-Third Street in September 2022. The exhibition, titled Art in Motion, will also be moved to September 2022 at the Art Fund, where it will engage with exploration of contemporary art and digital technology.
